metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Araj if you find her in Lower City
metadata.how_to_trigger: Click on S_MOO_InfernalVendor at Lower City

9.speaker: Araj Oblodra
9.text: FIRE IN THE - Oh! My silk, what are the chances  - it's you!
9.context:
NodeContext: Looking behind her shoulder after running out of an exploding building (though she's unscathed)

'My silk' as a stand in for 'my stars!' or 'my gods!'

32.speaker: Player
32.text: And, ahh, the heart-stopping bloodsucker. Ever since our last liaison, I haven't been able to get you out of my mind...
32.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

167.speaker: Araj Oblodra
167.text: And, ahh, the heart-stopping bloodsucker. Ever since our last liaison, I haven't been able to get you out of my mind...
167.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: Nor have I. No matter how hard I try.
52.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

44.speaker: Araj Oblodra
44.text: Forgive the fire and brimstone. Your blood is far more volatile than I'd anticipated.
44.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

130.speaker: Player
130.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

201.speaker: Player
201.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

178.speaker: Araj Oblodra
178.text: Never better. Don't mind the mess. I've been doing fascinating things with your blood sample.
178.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

190.speaker: Player
190.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

170.speaker: Araj Oblodra
170.text: It's a breakthrough in the sanguine arts the likes of which the world has never seen. The Grand Matriarch will have no choice but to restore House Oblodra after I present her with my research.
170.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

146.speaker: Araj Oblodra
146.text: But listen to me, rabbitting on about myself when I have you - the prize bleeder - on my very doorstep.
146.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

161.speaker: Araj Oblodra
161.text: If you'd come inside, we could discuss something far more exciting than drow politics.
161.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

15.speaker: Player
15.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

163.speaker: Araj Oblodra
163.text: Not if you lead me first!
163.context: NodeContext: Awkward, A little giddy with excitement.

198.speaker: Player
198.context: NodeContext: Trying to hide her excitement.

70.speaker: Araj Oblodra
70.text: YES! That is - do follow me.
70.context: NodeContext: Trying to hide her excitement.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Forget it. I saw how you made Astarion feel. I'm done with you.

113.speaker: Araj Oblodra
113.text: How I made him feel? What I propose goes well beyond such frivolities. We are talking about alchemical breakthroughs based on the blood that runs through your veins, my friend!

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: I appreciate the thought, but I'm not the person I was the last time we met. And if she can unlock the kind of power she's promising...

176.speaker: Astarion
176.text: Well, hearing her out won't kill us.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: You're right. Let's have a look.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: Just as long as she knows who belongs to who this time.

37.speaker: Araj Oblodra
37.text: Now, now. I do think that's enough. When you see what I've been working on, bygones will all be bygones, I assure you.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: Just a look. And if we don't like what we see, we can always kill her later.

195.speaker: Astarion
195.text: Don't worry - if anything happens, I'll protect you.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: Well, death never stopped me before. I don't know why it should now.

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: I appreciate the thought, truly, but if this is something you want to look into...

153.speaker: Araj Oblodra
153.text: Boh! A pity. But you may change your mind - and if you do, don't hesitate to seek me out. I'll always be happy to see you.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: You might want to stop doing them before you kill yourself.

132.speaker: Araj Oblodra
132.text: At the very edge of life and death is where one happens upon the true breakthroughs, my friend. That's how I discovered the delicious volatility of the blood sample you gave me.

122.speaker: Araj Oblodra
122.text: My research will be the greatest breakthrough in the sanguine arts in a century. The Grand Matriarch will have no choice but to restore House Oblodra when I present my findings.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I knew my blood was potent, but I didn't know it could do that.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Oblodra - the blood merchant. I hadn't hoped to meet you again.

179.speaker: Araj Oblodra
179.text: Lucky for us all, fate is more powerful than hope.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: You can really take some heat. I'm impressed.

142.speaker: Araj Oblodra
142.text: No no, my friend - I'm the one impressed by you.

143.speaker: Araj Oblodra
143.text: You see, it's your blood that caused the conflagration you just witnessed. Imagine!

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Astarion, we can leave if you don't want to be around her.

156.speaker: Astarion
156.text: Oh she doesn't bother me that much. If anything, I pity her.

180.speaker: Astarion
180.text: Don't worry, I can tolerate her.

168.speaker: Astarion
168.text: I would like to see her dead in a ditch, but I can tolerate this.

8.speaker: Araj Oblodra
8.text: Such harsh words for an old friend!

131.speaker: Araj Oblodra
131.text: But never mind all that. I have tremendously exciting news.

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: Now you're happy to leave if I'm uncomfortable? How novel.

191.speaker: Astarion
191.text: I'm fine. Let's just get this over with.
191.context: NodeContext: Terse, annoyed at the player

141.speaker: Astarion
141.text: I'll be all right. Let's just get this over with.

62.speaker: Araj Oblodra
62.text: Nervous to see me again, is he? How sweet.

56.speaker: Araj Oblodra
56.text: But! We have quite a bit to discuss. What a wonder you came to my door just when you did.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Astarion, we can leave if you don't want to be around her.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: You? You ruined my relationship with Astarion!

166.speaker: Astarion
166.text: No, give yourself some credit. You mostly ruined it all by yourself.

74.speaker: Araj Oblodra
74.text: Oh, I can only offer my consolation. And say to you, pretty leech, that you're missing out. They have blood the likes of which I've never seen.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: I'm glad Astarion isn't here to hear of your vile experiments.

26.speaker: Araj Oblodra
26.text: Oh, that perfect specimen is still travelling with you? And I missed him? What a terrible pity.

172.speaker: Araj Oblodra
172.text: But! All is far from lost!

188.speaker: Araj Oblodra
188.text: Forgive the mess. Your blood is far more volatile than I'd anticipated.

75.speaker: Araj Oblodra
75.text: Ah, and the heart-stopping bloodsucker. I hope you've changed your mind. My neck is yours, any time.

109.speaker: Astarion
109.text: And I will keep refusing until the end of time. I'm done bowing to the whims of others.

13.speaker: Araj Oblodra
13.text: I say, I'm positively giddy! Go on - drink the formula!
13.context: NodeContext: About to fight the player

67.speaker: Player
67.context: NodeContext: About to fight the player

199.speaker: Araj Oblodra
199.text: You... what?! Formula Gruna... the height of my research... you destroyed it?!
199.context: NodeContext: About to fight the player

137.speaker: Araj Oblodra
137.text: This won't do, darling. I'll have to take my work back in blood. Lots of it.
137.context: NodeContext: About to fight the player

14.speaker: Araj Oblodra
14.text: FIRE IN THE - Oh! My silk, what are the chances  - it's you!
14.context:
NodeContext: Looking behind her shoulder after running out of an exploding building (though she's unscathed)

'My silk' as a stand in for 'my stars!' or 'my gods!'

27.speaker: Araj Oblodra
27.text: Well, not you. But your travel companion. The one with the very special little friend stuck in their brain.

196.speaker: Araj Oblodra
196.text: I'm dying to speak with them. You will send them my way, won't you? Ta!

23.speaker: Araj Oblodra
23.text: Ah, my friend. If you've any more blood to spare, I'd be happy to exchange it for something of more use to you.
23.context:
NodeContext: 

'My silk' as a stand in for 'my stars!' or 'my gods!'

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Not today. Do you have anything else to trade?

24.speaker: Araj Oblodra
24.text: Oh! My silk, what are the chances  - it's you!
24.context:
NodeContext: 

'My silk' as a stand in for 'my stars!' or 'my gods!'

65.speaker: Araj Oblodra
65.text: Oh my - my heavens! You LIVED!

4.speaker: Araj Oblodra
4.text: This is incredible. I'm seeing stars!

61.speaker: Player
61.text: You seem surprised. Had you expected me to die?

171.speaker: Araj Oblodra
171.text: I'd hypothesised you wouldn't, my friend. And you've proven me absolutely correct.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: What did you do to me?

200.speaker: Araj Oblodra
200.text: You, my friend, have become something... something I once thought beyond achievement.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: You tricked me. You'll pay for that.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: If that was all it took to kill me, I'd have died a long time ago.

154.speaker: Araj Oblodra
154.text: My friend, I had no such intention. You don't know what this means to me - to my research!

20.speaker: Araj Oblodra
20.text: You are the world's first detonative  exsanguinator. To put it simply: From this day on, your blood goes boom. Big boom! Ahaha! It's incredible!

149.speaker: Araj Oblodra
149.text: All it needs is a spark.
149.context: NodeContext: Referring to her own neck.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: That seems quite powerful. Thank you.
104.context: NodeContext: Referring to her own neck.

95.speaker: Araj Oblodra
95.text: I assure you, the pleasure is entirely, entirely mine. This research will skyrocket House Oblodra back to the forefront of drow scientific thought. Indeed, it could protect my line for generations.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Is this going to kill me?
11.context: NodeContext: Referring to her own neck.

184.speaker: Araj Oblodra
184.text: Certainly not. But it might do damage to anyone who makes you bleed without your express permission.
184.context: NodeContext: Referring to her own neck.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Naturally, I always ask first. I'm civilised, unlike you.
10.context: NodeContext: Referring to her own neck.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: Naturally, I always ask first. I'm civilised, unlike you.
22.context: NodeContext: Referring to her own neck.

68.speaker: Araj Oblodra
68.text: There are other necks available for biting, of course. If you were so inclined.
68.context: NodeContext: Referring to her own neck.

41.speaker: Araj Oblodra
41.text: Now, let me offer you a little treat. In exchange for the teensiest vial of your marvellous blood, I'll give you something that'll really throw your enemies for a loop.

59.speaker: Araj Oblodra
59.text: I'll only ask a nominal fee in exchange.

159.speaker: Araj Oblodra
159.text: You really are a fine collaborator.

40.speaker: Araj Oblodra
40.text: Ah - I've already taken of you today; I'm afraid I can only use the first sample of the day. Nevertheless, if there's anything of mine that would be of use to you, do say so.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: You've had enough of my blood.

48.speaker: Araj Oblodra
48.text: Now now, darling. Let's not be rude...

6.speaker: Player
6.text: She said 'no'. You should learn the meaning of the word.

89.speaker: Astarion
89.text: They said 'no'. You should learn the meaning of the word.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Why do you need more of my blood so badly?

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Why do you need more of my blood so badly?

34.speaker: Araj Oblodra
34.text: My research will be quite worthless without proof. And my proof is running through your veins. I only need a tiny bit. Then - then my life will truly begin.

134.speaker: Araj Oblodra
134.text: Ah. I'd so hoped it wouldn't come to this. But I can't let my prize experiment walk out that door. I'd hoped to take a sample with your permission. But I can do without it.

5.speaker: Player
5.context: NodeContext: Growing agitated, might attack soon.

84.speaker: Araj Oblodra
84.text: Hold on, my friend, hold on. I do need a sample of that blood before you go. My research will be worthless without it.
84.context: NodeContext: Growing agitated, might attack soon.

85.speaker: Araj Oblodra
85.text: You say 'mad'. I say 'extraordinary'. We have that in common, my friend.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: My ancestors breathed fire - did you really think that would kill me?

182.speaker: Player
182.text: I am magic incarnate - it will take more than that to kill me.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: I should have known you would turn on me. We might have left the Underdark, but its treachery is never far behind.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: This is no poison I recognise. Talk - what did you do to me?

88.speaker: Araj Oblodra
88.text: You're ready to try Formula Gruna, aren't you?
88.context: NodeContext: You can pronounce the name phonetically/ as makes sense to you

108.speaker: Araj Oblodra
108.text: Ah, my friend. What can I do for you?
108.context: NodeContext: You can pronounce the name phonetically/ as makes sense to you

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Can I give you blood in exchange for some special items?

145.speaker: Araj Oblodra
145.text: I'm afraid your blood is of little interest to me. But perhaps I can interest you in some other items.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I'd like to see your wares.

114.speaker: Araj Oblodra
114.text: Oh, darling. If you aren't tadpoled, we have nothing to discuss.
114.context: NodeContext: You can pronounce the name phonetically/ as makes sense to you

125.speaker: Araj Oblodra
125.text: Ah, my friend. What can I do for you?
125.context: NodeContext: You can pronounce the name phonetically/ as makes sense to you

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Can I give you more blood in exchange for some special items?

165.speaker: Araj Oblodra
165.text: Not today, I'm afraid. I need a nice and juicy sample - take too often, and you drain your specimen dry!

71.speaker: Araj Oblodra
71.text: Still, I have other items that might interest you.

160.speaker: Araj Oblodra
160.text: You heard me the first time, didn't you, darling? I'd like to speak to your tadpoled friend, if you don't mind.
160.context: NodeContext: You can pronounce the name phonetically/ as makes sense to you

169.speaker: Araj Oblodra
169.text: Ah - a cosy little spot, isn't it? These four walls have witnessed greater alchemical triumphs than the keep of Urngath Dorrund!
169.context: NodeContext: You can pronounce the name phonetically/ as makes sense to you

87.speaker: Araj Oblodra
87.text: And now that you're here, the crown jewel of my research is soon to be faceted. All you have to do is drink Formula Gruna.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: If that's her 'formula' I can smell, it's even fouler than her blood. Gods below...

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: If that's her 'formula' I can smell, it's even fouler than her blood. Gods below...

107.speaker: Player
107.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

193.speaker: Araj Oblodra
193.text: Well yes. Formulae Arkku through Fruak were spectacular failures. But Gruna - Gruna is different. Believe me!

94.speaker: Player
94.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

28.speaker: Araj Oblodra
28.text: When you first entered this home, you saw the incredible latent power within your blood exposed in all its nuances. Formula Gruna will unleash that power within you.
28.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

17.speaker: Araj Oblodra
17.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: Say no - the only thing she's offering is pain and I don't want to see you hurt.
55.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I can probably handle a little fire, but I'm not sure about the rest of you.
66.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: I can probably handle a little fire, but I'm not sure about the rest of you.
93.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

29.speaker: Jaheira
29.text: Do you drink everything any petty mixer places in your hand? You must have a most colourful chamber pot.
29.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

42.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
42.text: I approve. Any who dare to make me bleed should suffer dire consequences.
42.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

97.speaker: Lae'zel
97.text: No, no, no. Does it really need to be said?
97.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

139.speaker: Wyll
139.text: I think a firm 'no thank you' is in order. Very firm.
139.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

157.speaker: Shadowheart
157.text: A potion that makes you explode? Seems a bit drastic.
157.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

164.speaker: Gale
164.text: One source of lethal explosive power in our party is quite enough. It seems ill-advised to add another.
164.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

177.speaker: Astarion
177.text: Do not trust anything this woman says. And certainly don't drink anything she offers you.
177.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

189.speaker: Minsc
189.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastically urging the player to drink a potion that makes their blood explode when exposed to air.

192.speaker: Halsin
192.text: A brew so potent, it makes you explode? Perhaps it has some use... though I struggle to see what.

63.speaker: Player
63.context: NodeContext: Player just accepted a disgusting/dangerous drink

82.speaker: Araj Oblodra
82.text: Oh, marvellous. I've never been so excited for anything in all my days! Just - stand over there. Far over there. And drink up!
82.context: NodeContext: Player just accepted a disgusting/dangerous drink

181.speaker: Araj Oblodra
181.text: Oh, marvellous. I've never been so excited for anything in all my days! Just - stand over there. Far over there. And drink up!
181.context: NodeContext: Player just accepted a disgusting/dangerous drink

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: What are you doing? That had better go down the drain and not down your gullet.
58.context: NodeContext: Player just accepted a disgusting/dangerous drink

138.text: Now, where the devil did that bottle go?! My silk! We can't continue without it!
138.context: NodeContext: 'My silk' as a stand in for 'my stars!' or 'my gods!'

83.speaker: Araj Oblodra
83.text: Now, where the devil did that bottle go?! My silk! We can't continue without it!
83.context: NodeContext: 'My silk' as a stand in for 'my stars!' or 'my gods!'

186.speaker: Player
186.text: I won't be drinking any mysterious formulas today, thanks.

81.speaker: Araj Oblodra
81.text: Not even for the betterment of the alchemical arts the realm over? Not even for that?

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: I trust you haven't forgotten what happened when I drank something she offered? This 'formula' won't be any kinder to you.
